placeholder.heading: Abatement of real property taxes for Howard Town Center.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-257
level.text: Law 19-257, the "Howard Town Center Real Property Tax Abatement Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-443. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Dec. 4, 2012, and Dec. 18, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Jan. 14, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-593 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-257 became effective on Apr. 20, 2013.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 3 of D.C. Law 19-257 provided that the act shall apply upon the inclusion of its fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan, as certified by the Chief Financial Officer to the Budget Director of the Council in a certification published by the Council in the District of Columbia Register.

placeholder.heading: The Elizabeth Ministry, Inc. Affordable Housing Initiative; Lots 140 and 141, Square 5252.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-253
level.text: Law 19-253, the "Elizabeth Ministry, Inc. Affordable Housing Initiative Real Property Tax Relief Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-443. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Dec. 4, 2012, and Dec. 18, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Jan. 14, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-589 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-253 became effective on Apr. 20, 2013.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 4 of D.C. Law 19-253 provided that the act shall apply upon inclusion of its fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan.

placeholder.heading: Parkside Parcel E and J Mixed-Income Apartments; Lot 808, Square 5041 and Lot 811, Square 5056.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-255
level.text: Law 19-255, the "Parkside Parcel E and J Mixed-Income Apartments Tax Abatement Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-741. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Dec. 4, 2012, and Dec. 18, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Jan. 12, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-591 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-255 became effective on Apr. 20, 2013.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 3 of D.C. Law 19-255 provided that the act shall apply upon the inclusion of its fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan, as certified by the Chief Financial Officer to the Budget Director of the Council in a certification published by the Council in the District of Columbia Register.

placeholder.heading: The Israel Senior Residences, Lot 60, Square 3848.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-285
level.text: Law 19-285, the "Israel Senior Residences Tax Exemption Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-800. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Dec. 4, 2012 and Dec. 18, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Jan. 29, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-652 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-285 became effective on April 27, 2013.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-285: Section 3 of D.C. Law 19-285 provided that the act shall apply upon the inclusion of its fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan, as certified by the Chief Financial Officer to the Budget Director of the Council in a certification published by the Council in the District of Columbia Register.
